titleStmt.title: Bargain and sale from Alexander Davenant to Anne Siderfin of Kennington, Surrey, 1691/2 February 22

publicationStmt.publisher: Collaboratory for Writing and Research on Culture (CWRC https://cwrc.ca) and Linked Editing Academic Framework (LEAF https://leaf-vre.org).

sourceDesc.p: Z.C.22 (43), Folger Shakespeare Library. A manuscript consisting of one and a half membrances of vellum, written in legal Secretary hand and lightly ornamented.

The manuscript is accompanied by a five-page typescript entitled "A transcript of Z.C.22(43) An Indenture for one-half share of Lisle's Tennis Court". The typescript pages are numbered two (2) through six (6); no page one (1) is present. The running header attributes the typescript to Hook, whom I presume to be Lucyle Hook.

projectDesc.p: Created using a template is made available for use with the LEAF-Writer semantic editor.

revisionDesc.change: Revised blank template for use with LEAF-Writer editor.

div.p:
THIS INDENTURE made the twenty second day of ffebruary in the fourth yeare of the Reigne of oure Sovereigne Lord and Lady William and Mary
by the Grace of God of England Scottland ffrance and Ireland King and Queene Defenders of the faith &c Annoq Domini 1691 BETWEENE Alexander Davenant of the
Parish of St Bridgetts also St Brides London Esqirere of the one part and Anne Siderfin of Kenington in the County of Surry Widow of the other part WHEREAS
Sir William Davenant late of London Knight [****] did in his life time by Indenture dated the seaventh day of Marche in the yeare of our Lord God one thousand
six hundred and sixty for the consideracion therein mencioned give grant assigne and sett over unto Richard Alchorne of Crowhurst in the County of Sussex Esqr
his excrs and admrs and assignes one halfe of one equall part or share of the Generall Receipts of the Theater erected in or neare Lisles Tennis Court in
Lincolne Inne Feilds in the County of Middx in fifteene eqall parts to be devided That is to say one halfe of one of the tenne shares which by virtue of
certaine Articles of Agreemt Indented Tripartite dated the fiftheenth day of Novembr in the yeare of our Lord God 1660 made Betweene the said Sr William
Davenant of the first part Thomas Betterton Thomas Sheppey and others of the second part and Henry Harris of London Painter of the third part that
were reserved to the said Sr Williams Davenant of which said one halfe share the said Richard Alchorne ... was to have and receive
the clear neate profitts ariseing ratably and in proporcon as the said Sr William Davenant and his heires execrs admrs or assignes were to have and receive for the
remaineing shares of the said tenne shares And the said Richard Alchorne ... were from the makeing of the first above recited Indenture
to contribute towards the groweing charges and disbursemts in respect of the one halfe of one equall part or share ratably and in proporcon as the said Sr William Davenant was by the said recited Articles to contribute for the said tenne shares AND WHEREAS the said Sr William Davenant by the said first recited INDR amongst other things did covenant with the said Richd Alchorne ... that in case he the said Sr William Davenant ... should remove or cause to be removed the said Company by the said Articles constituted and their Associates or their Successors to any other Theater or Theaters therein to act Comedyes Tragedyes Plays or Representacons he the said Sr William Davenant ... should constantly and dayly or weekly on the severall Saturdays in every weeke pay or cause to be payd and that every of them should permitt to be payd respectively to the said Richd Alchorne ... one half of one equall part or share of the whole receipts of such other Theater or Theaters in fifteene equall parts to be devided from and immediately after the first performeing acting or shewing any Comedy or Tragedy Play or Representacon therein from time to time for and dureing all and every such time and times as any Comedyes Tragedyes Plays and Representacons should be acted performed or showed in such Theater or Theaters or any of them by any such permission order direccon approbacon Privily or procuremt as in the said first recited Indenture is exprest or by virtue of any authority grant lycence or dispensacon made or to be made as therein alsoe is menconed deducting allowing and contributeing as in the said first recited Indenture is for that purpose exprest. AND WHEREAS the said Richard Alchorne by his Indr dated the twentyeth day of March Anno Dmni 1660 for the Consideracon therein menconed did give grant bargaine assigne and sett over unto Phineas Cheston of London Marchant ... one full fourth part in four equall parts to be devided of and in the said one halfe of one of the said tenne shares of the said receipts of the said Theater in fifteene equall parts and shares to be devided as aforesaid deducting allowing and contributeing proporcenably as in the same Indenture is for that purpose exprest. AND WHEREAS the said Richard Alchorne by his Indenture bearing date the eighteenth day of August Anno Dni 1662 for the Consideracon therein mentoned did giv sett over unto John Roffey of Lambeth in the County of Surry Gen ... three full fourth parts in four equall parts or shares to be divided of and in the said one halfe of one of the said tenne shares of the said Generall Receipts of the said Theater in fifteene equall parts or shares to be devided as aforesaid THAT is to say three full fourth parts of the said one half of one tenth share deducting allowing and contributeing proporconably as in the same Indr is for that purpose exprest. AND WHEREAS the said Phineas Cheston by his Indr bearing date the tenth day of January Anno Dni 1664 for the Consideracon therein menconed did ... set over unto the said John Roffey ... the said full one fourth part of and in the said one half of one of the said tenne shares of the said Generall Receipts deducting allowing and contributeing as in the same Indr is for that purpose exprest whereby the said John Roffey did become intituled unto all that half part or share of the same Generall Receipts granted as aforesaid by the said Sr William Davenant to the said Richard Alchorne AND WHEREAS the said John Roffey by his Indenture bearing date the six and twentyeth day of June Anno Dni 1669 the Consideracon therein menconed did grant ... unto Thomas Betterton of the Parish of St. Gyles in the feilds in the County of Middx Gen ... the said one half of one equall part or share of the said Generall Receipts in fifteene equall parts to be devided deducted allowing and contributeing as in the same Indenture is for that purpose exprest AND WHEREAS the said Thomas Betterton by his Indenture bearing date the nineteenth day of Octobr Anno Dni 1681 for the Consideracon therein menconed did together with one other share of him the said Thomas Betterton ... sett over unto Thomas Fowle of the Parish of St Dunstans in the West London Goldsmith (since Sr Thomas Fowle Knight ... the said one halfe share or part of the said receipts heretofore granted by the said Sr William Davenant to the said Richard Alchorne AND WHEREAS the said Thomas Fowle (since Sr Thomas Fowle Knight by his Indenture bearing date the seaventh day of January Anno Dni 1684 for the Consideracon therein menconed did together with one other halfe share of him the said Sr Thomas Fowle ... sett over unto the said George Rivers ... the said one halfe share or part of the said Receipts heretofore granted as aforesaid by the said Sr William Davenant to the said Richard Alchorne AND WHEREAS the said George Rivers by his Indr bearing date the ninth day of Decembr Anno Dni 1687 for the Consideracon therein menconed did grant ... unto the said Alexander Davenant ... the one half of one equall part or share of the said receits in fifteene equall parts or shares to be divided That is to say one halfe of one of the tenne shares aforesaid which by virtue of the said recited Articles were reserved to the said Sr William Davenant and by the said severall recited meane Conveyances or otherwise derived downe to him the said Alexander Davenant as by the said severall recited Indentures amongst divers Covenants and things therein respectively conteyned may appeare NOW THIS INDENTURE WITNESSETH that the said Alexander Davenant for and in consideracon of the Sume of four hundred ninety and five pounds of lawfull money of England by the said Anne Siderfin to him the said Alexander Davenant in hand payd at and before the ensealing and delivery of these prsents and receit whereof the said Alexander Davenant doth hereby acknowledge and thereof and of every part and parcell thereof doth acquitt release and discharge the said Anne Siderfin hir execrs admrs and assignes for ever by these prsents HATH granted bargained sold assigned and sett over and by these prsents doth ... sett over unto the said Anne Siderfin ... the said one half of one equall part or share of the said Generall receipts and profitts of the said Theater or Theaters in fifteene equall parts or shares to be divided That is to say one half of one of the tenne shares aforesaid which by virtue of the said recited Articles were reserved to the said Sr William Davnant TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the said halfe part or halfe share of the said Generall Receipts and the proceed and profitts thereof unto the said Anne Siderfin ... from henceforth for evermore in as large ample and beneficiall manner to all intents and purposes together with all libertyes adn priviledges incident belonging or anyways appertayneing thereunto as he the said Alexander Davenant ... might could or of right ought to have had and enjoyed the same if these prsents had not been made AND the said Alexander Davenant for himselfe his heires execrs and admrs doth covenant promise and grant to and with the said Anne Siderfin hir heires execrs ADMINISTRATORS and assignes by these prsents that the said Alexander Davenant hath not at any time heretofore made any former bargaine sale gift grant Surrender Assignemt charge incumbrance Act or thing whatesoever whereby or by meanes whereof the said prmises or any part thereof are or may be surrendred determined charged impeached or incumbered in title Interest or estate or otherwise howsoever And that the said Anne Siderfin ... shall and may from time to time and at all times hereafter have hold enjoy receive and take the saide halfe part or halfe share of the said Generall Receipts of the said Theater and Theaters and all the proceed and profitts thereof and all other the priviledges and benefitts belonging thereunto and herein before granted or intended to be granted free and cleere of and from all former grants charge assessements Statutes Judgemts Recognizances and incumbrances claymes and demands whatesover had made comitted or done or knowingly or willfully permitted to be done by the said Alexander Davenant or any other person or persons claymeing from or under him AND lastly that the said Alexander Davenant ... shall and will from time to time and at all times hereafter at the reasonable request cost and charges in the law of the said Anne Siderfin ... doe and cause and procure and suffer to be made and done all such further and other Act and Acts thing and things for the further and better assureing of the prmisses to the said Anne Siderfin hir heires execrs admrs and assignes as by hir and them or by hir and their Councill learned in the law shall for that purpose be reasonably devised and required IN WITTNESSE whereof the Partyes first above named to these prsent Indentures interchangeably have sett their hands and seales the day and yeare first abovewritten.
